Description:
SummaryThe Logistic Specialist is responsible for overseeing and managing all logistical activities associated with the ENOWA power generation projects, which include solar, wind, geothermal, thermal (grid-connected), and off-grid power generation. The Logistic Specialist ensures the timely and efficient delivery, storage, and movement of materials, equipment, and personnel throughout the design, construction, and operational phases of the project.Key Accountabilities and ResponsibilitiesEngineering Management       Coordinate with suppliers, contractors, and project teams to ensure a smooth flow of materials and equipment as required.
Evaluate supply chain performance and identify areas for optimization.
Oversee the transportation of materials, equipment, and personnel, ensuring timely deliveries while minimizing costs.
Coordinate with transport providers, ensuring compliance with safety and environmental regulations.
Monitor and manage inventory levels at storage sites, ensuring adequate stock while minimizing surplus and obsolescence.
Implement efficient inventory control methods and systems.
Ensure all logistical activities adhere to local, national, and international regulations.
Maintain accurate records of all incoming and outgoing shipments, inventory levels, and transport activities.
Identify, evaluate, and collaborate with external logistics providers and vendors.
Negotiate contracts and service level agreements to secure cost-effective solutions.
Develop and manage the logistics budget, monitoring expenditures and identifying cost-saving opportunities.
Provide periodic cost reports and forecasts to senior management.
Address logistical challenges swiftly, devising solutions to prevent disruptions.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to troubleshoot and resolve logistical issues.
Provide regular logistic performance updates to senior management and other relevant parties.Background, SkillsIn-depth understanding of logistics, supply chain management, and transportation principles, preferably within the power generation sector.
Strong analytical, organizational, and problem-solving skills.
Proficient in logistics software tools and platforms.
Effective communication and negotiation abilities.
Experience working in large-scale or giga projects, handling complex logistics requirements.
Outstanding problem-solving skills, with the ability to identify, analyze, and resolve technical challenges.
Highly effective communication skills to liaise with internal teams, external partners, and regulatory authorities.
Strong organizational skills and the ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously.
Strong leadership skills and ability to work independently and in a team.
Travels to project sites as needed.QualificationsBachelor's degree in Logistics, Supply Chain Management, Business Administration, or a related field.
Minimum of 8 years of experience in logistics and supply chain management, with a preference for experience in the power generation sector.
Relevant professional certifications, such as Certified Supply Chain Professional (CSCP) or Certified in Production and Inventory Management (CPIM), would be beneficial.Job Details
